title: ğŸ” GET /get_account_freq
text:
Returns the frequency (such as Monthly, Weekly, etc.) currently assigned to a grandchild account.




Method: GET

URL: /get_account_freq

Tag: accounts





Authorization: Bearer <your-token>
Content-Type: application/json







Name
Type
Required
Description




uuid
string
âœ…
UUID of the grandchild account







GET /get_account_freq?uuid=acc-7890 HTTP/1.1
Authorization: Bearer <your-token>



{
  "success": true,
  "status": 200,
  "uuid": "acc-7890",
  "freq": 30,
  "start_time": "2025-07-10T16:05:12.003Z",
  "end_time": "2025-07-10T16:05:12.020Z",
  "execution_time": 0.017
}












Status
Description




400
Missing uuid


403
Account not found or not a grandchild account


404
Account tree not found or unauthorized access


500
Internal server error








This endpoint is limited to accounts inheriting from GrandchildAccount.
The returned frequency is expected to be a predefined label (e.g., 7, 30, 14) based on your internal logic.

title: ğŸ”„ POST /change_account_status
text:
Changes the status of a child or grandchild account. Main or parent accounts are not eligible for this operation.




Method: POST
URL: /change_account_status
Tag: accounts





Authorization: Bearer <your-token>
Content-Type: application/json













Name
Type
Required
Description




uuid
string
âœ…
UUID of the account to update


status
string
âœ…
New status to apply: "active", "inactive", or "closed"







{
  "uuid": "abc123-child-account",
  "status": "inactive"
}



{
  "success": true,
  "status": 200,
  "uuid": "abc123-child-account",
  "new_status": "inactive",
  "message": "Account Rent status updated to inactive",
  "start_time": "2025-07-10T07:10:10.003Z",
  "end_time": "2025-07-10T07:10:10.022Z",
  "execution_time": 0.019
}










Status
Description




400
Missing parameters or invalid status value


403
Attempt to change a non-child account or unauthorized access


404
Account not found


500
Unexpected server error







Status transitions may impact how funds are allocated (e.g., inactive sub-accounts stop drawing allocations).
Only accounts inheriting from ChildAccount class are eligible.
This endpoint is locked via with_account_lock() to prevent race conditions during status changes.

title: ğŸ“ˆ GET /walking_amount
text:
Returns the â€œwalking amountâ€ (cumulative total) of either amount_due or balance for a given account and its children across a date range.




Method: GET
URL: /walking_amount
Tag: accounts





Authorization: Bearer <your-token>
Content-Type: application/json













Name
Type
Required
Description




uuid
string
âœ…
UUID of the account


amt_type
string
âŒ
Type of amount to walk: "amount_due" or "balance" (default: "amount_due")


from
string
âŒ
Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: very early date)


to
string
âŒ
End date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)







GET /walking_amount?uuid=acc-2024-xyz&amt_type=balance&from=2024-01-01&to=2024-12-31



{
  "success": true,
  "status": 200,
  "uuid": "acc-2024-xyz",
  "amt_type": "balance",
  "from": "2024-01-01",
  "to": "2024-12-31",
  "walking_amount": [
    {
      "date": "2024-01-01",
      "value": 0
    },
    {
      "date": "2024-01-15",
      "value": 1200
    },
    {
      "date": "2024-02-01",
      "value": 2000
    }
    // ...
  ],
  "start_time": "2025-07-10T07:00:01.003Z",
  "end_time": "2025-07-10T07:00:01.023Z",
  "execution_time": 0.02
}






Status
Cause




400
UUID or date params are missing/invalid


403
Account not found or unauthorized


404
Tree or user not found


500
Internal processing error







Use amt_type = â€œamount_dueâ€ to get cumulative liabilities (default).
Use amt_type = â€œbalanceâ€ to visualize asset accumulation.
Under the hood, uses account$walking_amount(amt_type, daterange).

Name
Type
Required
Description




user_id
string
âœ…
Unique ID for the user (e.g., UUID)







{

}




{

  "status": 201,
  "message": "User directory created",

Reason

Missing required user_id


400
Invalid user ID format


409
User already exists

Internal server error








user_id must be a valid string identifier (UUIDs recommended).
User ID is sanitized and used to generate a secure directory structure.
No JWT token required, but rate limiting and exponential backoff are applied to prevent abuse.
The request is fast and designed for one-time setup per user.

title: Finance Manager API: Overview
text: This vignette provides an overview of how to interact with the Finance Manager API from R. It demonstrates how to simulate client interactions such as account registration, login, and balance queries.

title: Finance Manager API: Overview
text: This vignette provides an overview of how to interact with the Finance Manager API from R. It demonstrates how to simulate client interactions such as account registration, login, and balance queries.

title: Finance Manager API: Overview
text:
API set up
This part is only needed if the API is not hosted. Since the server is not deployed publicly, we start the API server locally in the background using the callr package. This lets us send HTTP requests to the locally running server just like a real client would.

First set up the env variables

tmp_dir <- tempfile("test-api-deposit-") 
dir.create(tmp_dir, recursive = TRUE)    # creating a temporally accounts folder
                                         # this will be permanent dir on deployment
Sys.setenv(ACCOUNT_BASE_DIR = tmp_dir)   # use tempfile to avoid contamination
Sys.setenv(ACCOUNT_BACKEND = "file")     # default storage backend(local dir)
Sys.setenv(MAX_REQUESTS = 1000)          # maximum requests per rate limit
Sys.setenv(WINDOW_SIZE = 3600)           # rate limit window size
Sys.setenv(JWT_SECRET = "test-secret")   # secret Key for signing tokens
secret_key <- Sys.getenv("JWT_SECRET")



Function to listen if server is live
This function pings the server after every 0.1 seconds with a timeout of 80 seconds to establish if its live. Its a way to avoid sending request when server is not live.

wait_for_server_ready <- function(
  url = "http://127.0.0.1:8000/__ping__",
  timeout = 40
) {
  start_time <- Sys.time()
  while (as.numeric(Sys.time() - start_time, units = "secs") < timeout) {
    res <- tryCatch(httr::GET(url), error = function(e) NULL)
    if (!is.null(res) && httr::status_code(res) == 200) return(TRUE)
    Sys.sleep(0.10)
  }
  stop("Server did not become ready within timeout.")
}



Spin up the server
Spin up the server on background but capture both std output and stderr for debugging. > This approach is ideal for testing and documenting the API without requiring a live deployment.

log_out <- tempfile("server-out-", fileext = ".log")
log_err <- tempfile("server-err-", fileext = ".log")

server <- callr::r_bg(
  function(main_file, jwt, base_dir, project_dir) {
    setwd(project_dir)
    Sys.setenv(JWT_SECRET = jwt)
    Sys.setenv(ACCOUNT_BASE_DIR = base_dir)
    Sys.setenv(ACCOUNT_BACKEND = "file")
    source(main_file)
  },
  args = list(
    main_file = here("api", "main.R"),
    jwt = secret_key,
    base_dir = tmp_dir,
    project_dir = here()
  ),
  stdout = log_out,
  stderr = log_err
)


withr::defer({
  if (server$is_alive()) server$kill()
  cat("ğŸ“¤ Server stdout:\n")
  cat(readLines(log_out, warn = FALSE), sep = "\n")
  cat("\nğŸ“¥ Server stderr:\n")
  cat(readLines(log_err, warn = FALSE), sep = "\n")
}, envir = parent.frame())

ğŸ“¤ Server stdout:


ğŸ“¥ Server stderr:




Wait for the server to be ready.

wait_for_server_ready("http://127.0.0.1:8000/__ping__")

[1] TRUE

title: Finance Manager API: Overview
text:
Interact with the server.
This is where where to start if the server is hosted.

create auth token
You need to a signed JWT authorization token to access the API. this API being part of backend it is assumed when users are signed in from the front end they are granted the auth token below.

user_id =uuid::UUIDgenerate()                 # generate a user id
token <- jwt_encode_hmac(
  jwt_claim(user_id = user_id, role = "user"),
  secret = secret_key
)



1) create account.
create a user account. this will return the base/root account.

  res <- POST(
    url = "http://127.0.0.1:8000/register",
    httr::add_headers(Authorization = paste("Bearer", token)),
    body = list(user_id = user_id),
    encode = "json"
  )
  parsed <- jsonlite::fromJSON(rawToChar(res$content))
  print(parsed)

text:
Computes how much of the income was spent within a given date range for a specific account and its children.




Method: GET
URL: /income_utilization
Auth: Required
Tag: accounts





Authorization: Bearer <your-token>
Content-Type: application/json













Name
Type
Required
Description




uuid
string
âœ…
UUID of the account


from
string
âŒ
Start date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to earliest date


to
string
âŒ
End date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to today







GET /income_utilization?uuid=acc-2024-001&from=2024-01-01&to=2024-12-31



{
  "success": true,
  "status": 200,
  "uuid": "acc-2024-001",

  "to": "2024-12-31",
  "utilization": 0.82,
  "start_time": "2025-07-10T16:00:15.012Z",
  "end_time": "2025-07-10T16:00:15.061Z",
  "execution_time": 0.049
}






Status
Reason




400
UUID is missing or invalid


403
Unauthorized access


404
Account or tree not found


500
Internal server error or date parsing







Internally uses account$income_utilization(date_range).
Utilization = spending / income, typically between 0 and 1.
Returns 0 if no income is recorded during the range.
Accepts optional from and to parameters for flexible filtering.

title: ğŸ” Auth Filter
text:
Scope: All protected endpoints
Route Type: Global filter (@filter auth)
Tag: auth



The auth filter is applied to all incoming requests While /login and /__ping__, are exempt from JWT authentication, they are still subject to rate limiting and exponential backoff to prevent brute-force attacks.
It performs these responsibilities:

ğŸ”‘ Verifies Bearer token from the Authorization header
ğŸ§¾ Decodes token and attaches user_id and role to the request
ğŸ“Š Enforces rate limiting using MAX_REQUESTS per WINDOW_SIZE
â³ Applies exponential backoff for repeated failed logins





Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1...












Condition
Status
Example Error




Missing or malformed token
401
{ "error": "Missing or invalid token" }


Invalid or expired token
401
{ "error": "Invalid or expired token" }


Too many failed attempts
429
{ "error": "Too many failed attempts. Wait 8s." }


Rate limit exceeded
429
{ "error": "Rate limit exceeded. Try later." }


Misconfigured secret
500
{ "error": "Server misconfigured (missing JWT_SECRET)" }







If the token is valid, your endpoint functions will have:
req$user_id  # Unique user ID
req$role     # Role, e.g., "user", "admin"
The filter logic is defined in plumber.R using @filter auth.












Env Variable
Purpose
Default




JWT_SECRET
Secret key for decoding JWT
(required)


MAX_REQUESTS
Max allowed requests in the window
1000


WINDOW_SIZE
Rate limit window duration in seconds
3600

Name
Type
Required
Description




parent_uuid
string
âœ…
UUID of the parent account


name
string
âœ…
Name of the new account (must be unique under this parent)


allocation
float
âœ…
Allocation percentage (between 0 and 1)


priority
int
âŒ
Priority weight for ordering (default: 0)


fixed_amount
float
âŒ
Fixed allocation amount (only used for grandchild accounts)


due_date
string
âŒ
Optional due date (ISO-8601 format)


account_type
string
âŒ
Type of grandchild account (e.g., â€œloanâ€, â€œexpenseâ€)


freq
int
âŒ
Frequency of recurring charges (used only for grandchild accounts)







{
  "parent_uuid": "acc-main-2023-001",
  "name": "Rent",
  "allocation": 0.3,
  "priority": 1,
  "fixed_amount": 2000,

  "account_type": "fixed",
  "freq": 30
}

Error Reason




404
Parent account not found


400
Invalid allocation or name already exists

Unexpected system or conversion errors

Locks the userâ€™s account tree during modification.
All accounts are persisted to account_tree.Rds.

text:
Welcome to the documentation for the Personal Finance Manager API â€” a secure backend built with Plumber in R for managing user account trees, transactions, and personal finances.






Auth Filter





POST /register
POST /login
POST /deposit
POST /withdraw
POST /distribute
POST /set_child_allocations
POST /move_balance
POST /change_account_status
POST /set_priority

GET /get_account_freq
GET /get_account_periods











Most endpoints require a valid Bearer JWT token in the Authorization header. Auth and rate limiting are enforced globally via a request filter.
Authorization: Bearer <your-token>





Account creation and persistent storage (per user)
Deposits, withdrawals, transfers, and account hierarchy logic
Fully modular backend logic powered by the finman R package
Works with Shiny, React, or any frontend via HTTP






Register a user (/register)
Login to receive token (/login)
Use your token to make authenticated requests (e.g., /deposit, /accounts)
Each request is validated and tracked for rate limits

text:

URL: /distribute

Name
Type
Required
Description




uuid
string
âœ…
UUID of the parent account


amount
float
âœ…
Amount to distribute (must be > 0)


transaction
string
âŒ
Optional transaction reference (autogenerated if NULL)


initiated_by
string
âŒ
Who performed the distribution (default = â€œSystemâ€)







{
  "uuid": "parent-acc-2023-001",
  "amount": 5000,
  "transaction": "dist-INV004",
  "by": "System"
}

}

Reason




403
Unauthorized to access the account


404
Account not found


500
Invalid amount, zero, negative, or missing account








Automatically uses account$distribute_to_children() internally.
Locks the account tree for safe concurrent execution.
Will fail if amount is missing, zero, or negative.
If transaction reference is missing, one is auto-generated.

title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ DELETE /delete
text:
Deletes a user account/sub accounts. If the target account is the root account its associated data file is removed, if a sub-account, only the account node is removed. Requires a valid uuid for target account parameter. Returns success message or appropriate error if the user doesnâ€™t exist or deletion fails.



Method: DELETE URL: /delete Auth: Not Required Tag: accounts â€”



Authorization: Bearer <your-token>
Content-Type: application/json







Name
Type
Required
Description




uuid
string
âœ…
Unique account identifier uuid






DELETE /delete?uuid=4a76343a-e971-4bd7-b8c4-5fa9fccee433




{
  "success": true,
  "status": 200,
  "message": "Account for user_id '4a76343a-e971-4bd7-b8c4-5fa9fccee433' deleted successfully.",
  "start_time": "2025-07-17T08:34:02.123Z",
  "end_time": "2025-07-17T08:34:02.160Z",
  "execution_time": 0.037
}







Status
Reason




400
Missing required user_id


404
Account for given user_id not found


500
Internal server error during deletion



{
  "success": false,
  "status": 404,
  "error": "Account for user_id 'xyz' does not exist.",
  "start_time": "2025-07-17T08:34:02.123Z",
  "end_time": "2025-07-17T08:34:02.150Z",
  "execution_time": 0.027
}





The user ID is used to identify the userâ€™s account file (e.g., account_tree.Rds) in persistent storage.
The operation is wrapped in a file lock to ensure safe concurrent access.
No JWT token required, but the endpoint is still protected by rate limiting and exponential backoff to prevent abuse.
This is a destructive operation and should be called with caution.
